nodes.title: Flexion
nodes.description: Decreasing the angle between the bones of the limb at a joint. Bending of a joint.

nodes.title: Extension
nodes.description: Increasing the angle between the bones of the limb at a joint. Straightening of a joint.

nodes.title: Dorsiflexion
nodes.description: Raising the foot/hand towards the shin/forearm.

nodes.title: Plantar Flexion
nodes.description: Pointing the foot/hand downwards away from the shin/forearm.

nodes.title: Adduction
nodes.description: Movement of a body part towards the body's midline. "Adding" to the body.

nodes.title: Abduction
nodes.description: Movement of a body part away from the body's midline.

nodes.title: Inversion
nodes.description: Tilting the sole of the foot/hand towards the body's midline.

nodes.title: Eversion
nodes.description: Tilting the sole of the foot/hand away from the body's midline.

nodes.title: Circumduction
nodes.description: Circular movement of a limb (e.g. arm, leg). A combination of  flexion, extension, adduction and abduction.

nodes.title: Rotation
nodes.description: Twisting movement of a body part. Internal rotation is rotating a joint towards the body's midline, while external rotation is rotating a joint away from the body's midline.

nodes.title: Hyper-Motions
nodes.description: Movement past the normal range of motion. For example, hyperextension is where the joint moves beyond the normal angle of extension.

data.title: Superior / Cranial
data.description: A structure is "superior" to another if it is closer to the head or higher. Not used with respect to the limbs.

data.title: Inferior / Caudal
data.description: A structure is "inferior" to another if it is closer to the feet or lower. Not used with respect to the limbs.

data.title: Medial
data.description: A structure is "medial" to another if it is closer to the median plane. "Median" is not synonymous with "median."

data.title: Lateral
data.description: A structure is "lateral" to another if it is further away from the median plane.

data.title: Proximal
data.description: A structure is "proximal" to another if it is closer to the median plane or the root of the limb. Only used with reference to the limbs.

data.title: Distal
data.description: A structure is "distal" to another if it is farther away from the median plane or the root of the limb. Only used with reference to the limbs.

data.title: Anterior
data.description: A structure is "anterior" to another if it is more in front in the body.

data.title: Posterior
data.description: A structure is "anterior" to another if it is farther back in the body.

data.title: Ipsilateral
data.description: A structure is "ipsilateral" if it is on the same side as the reference point.

data.title: Contralateral
data.description: A structure is "ipsilateral" if it is on the opposite side of the reference point.
